title.narrative: Realizing Education's Promise: Support to Indonesia's Ministry of Religious Affairs for Improved Quality of Education

description.narrative: To improve the management of primary and secondary education services under the Ministry of Religious Affairs (MoRA).

condition.narrative: Section I.A.2 of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementThe Borrower, through MORA, shall establish, not later than September 30, 2019,and thereafter maintain throughout the Project implementation period, a Project Management Unit (PMU), with a mandate, compositionand resources satisfactory to the Bank. Without limitation to the foregoing, the Project Management Unit shall be responsible forday-to-day implementation, management and reporting of the Project.

Section I.A.3 of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementThe Borrower, through MORA, shall establish, not later than September 30, 2019,and thereafter maintain throughout the Project implementation period, a Steering Committee, with a mandate, composition andresources satisfactory to the Bank. Without limitation to the foregoing, the Steering Committee shall: (a) be chaired by theDirector General responsible for Islamic education; (b) include representatives from relevant units/directorates in MORA; and (c)be responsible for, inter alia: (i) providing overall strategic and policy guidance on all activities carried out under theProject; and (ii) facilitating coordination for the implementation of Project activities.

title.narrative: Increased access to improved in-service training for primary and secondary teachers and education personnel
Increase in achievement of school-based National Education Standards (NES)
Teachers informed of student test questions and scores in same academic year test is given
Make data on Grade 4 student learning outcomes in three subjects available to teachers in the same school year that the task is given
Increased access of females to school Director candidate training
e-RKAM system used by schools for planning and budgeting
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Improve availability and quality of system-wide education data for decision-making

baseline.value: Accurate, comprehensive and timely data not available

target.value: Improved score on accuracy audit from Year 3

title.narrative: New in-service training materials for peer learning groups developed and made accessible

baseline.value: New in-service training materials not available

target.value: In-service training materials for peer learning groups made accessible to 12,000 groups

title.narrative: 4th grade asessment instruments developed and validated

target.value: Test items revised as necessary and validated

title.narrative: Unique identifiers for key data entities defined and applied across key systems

target.value: EMIS and Simpatika use unique identifiers for key data entities

actual.value: EMIS already uses unique IDs and these will need to cross-applied in Simpatika.

title.narrative: Resolution of complaints related to project activities is established, updated, and key information is placed on the project website
MoRA policy on EMIS developed, approved and implemented
Teachers recruited or trained - Female (RMS requirement)
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female
